title: The thing that scares me about the new runes
body: Is the same what happened with newly introduced items like {{item:3146}}. Champs like {{champion:84}} were so  broken with those items that Riot nerfed the champ instead of the item, which made it mandatory for them to buy. Same thing could happen with e.g. the Ultimore rune where Riot gives Karthus a 250 CD ult so he is forced to take this rune everytime.

> [{quoted}](name=Fertsa,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ZuXEW1wK,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-08-31T10:30:09.667+0000)
>
> Karthus after casting his ult 10 times, where ultimore caps out, with 40% CDR, has an ult CD of 80/72/64 seconds


my god. Thats horrifying

You have to cast the ult 10 times to get the most out of the rune. It's gonna take like 20-30 minutes to cast his ult that many times as Karthus, provided you ult the instant it's off cooldown. The rune is better on champions who can already ult often, like Lux. It's hard to say how good it actually is without seeing what you're giving up for the CDR.

Ultimore will be...well...probably less useful on Karthus than any other possible runes. He has a _very long_ CD on it. Ultimore will be best on those with medium to medium-long CDs, so that it's impactful, but actually stackable within a reasonable amount of time.

It'll only become great on Karthus in _long_ games. Trust me on that one.

I think it'll still be pretty strong.  It's true that it'll be harder to stack, but Karthus doesn't normally buy CDR items except Zhonya's anyways.

What I think will make Ultimore strong on him is the 'automatic max CDR' portion of the rune.  It'll take him forever to stack it, but having 40% cdr right off the bat (chopping over a minute off of his rank 1 ult CD), on a champ who will never come close to the CDR cap otherwise is still going to be pretty strong.

I don't think he's going to be the worst abuser of it, but there's a pretty good chance that it's going to be one of the better runes for him.

Ultimore doesn't give you 40% cdr off your ult for free,  it just increases your _max cdr cap_ so your ult can _get_ to that 60% cdr ult reduction. It really only gives the extra 20% through the stacking (which will take a long time for a champion who doesn't build cdr and who has a long cd on the ult).

 It's why everyone is saying low ult, cdr building champions will like this rune the most.

You'll still need to build CDR normally for this rune to work at it's maximum, so it'll take mid to late game to reach 40% cdr and why it was grouped with the other late-game rune.

Well, it says right there in the reveal at [https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/3THTrhmb-runes-corner-late-game-focused-runes](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/3THTrhmb-runes-corner-late-game-focused-runes)

> Gain 5% cooldown reduction and **maximum cooldown reduction on your ultimate**. This increases by 1.5% each time you cast your ultimate. Stacks up to 10 times.

If that's changed then yeah, it definitely won't be that good for Karthus.

EDIT:  Nevermind, I read that catastrophically wrong.  It's definitely not going to be a gamechanger for Karth.
It doesn't give you an automatic 40% CDR, it increases the CDR cap. It's literately a scaling Intelligence for ultimates.
